original: Cūḷaniddesa
analyzed: cūḷa niddesa
translated: The Shorter Expositions

original: Pārāyanavagganiddesa🔽Pucchāniddesa
analyzed: pārāyana vagga niddesa  pucchā niddesa
translated: The Exposition of the Pārāyanavagga🔽The Exposition of the Questions

original: 10. Kappamāṇavapucchāniddesa
translated: The Exposition of the Questions of Kappa the Māṇava

original: Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ,
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: “Standing in the middle of the lake,

original: (iccāyasmā kappo)🔽Oghe jāte mahabbhaye;🔽Jarāmaccuparetānaṁ,
analyzed: i t ca ayasmā kappo  oghe jāte mahat bhaye  jarā maccu paretāna
translated: (So said the venerable Kappa)🔽“When the flood has arisen, a great danger,

original: Dīpaṁ pabrūhi mārisa;
analyzed: dīpam pabrūhi mārisa
translated: For those who are carried away by aging and death,🔽Please tell me, dear sir, an island.

original: Tvañca me dīpamakkhāhi,
analyzed: tvam ca me dīpam akkhāhi
translated: You tell me an island,

original: Yathāyidaṁ nāparaṁ siyā.
analyzed: yathā ayi idam na aparam siyā
translated: So that this will not be again.”

original: Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhatanti saro vuccati saṁsāro āgamanaṁ gamanaṁ gamanāgamanaṁ kālaṁ gati bhavābhavo cuti ca upapatti ca nibbatti ca bhedo ca jāti ca jarā ca maraṇañca.
analyzed: majjhe sarasmim saraḥ vuccati sa sāraḥ āgamanam gamanam gamana āgamanam kālam gati bhava abhavaḥ cuti ca upapatti ca nibbatti ca bhedo ca jāti ca jarā ca maraṇañca
translated: “Standing in the middle of the lake” : the round of rebirths is called a lake. Coming and going, going and coming, time, destiny, becoming and birth, death and rebirth, birth and aging, death and sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

original: Saṁsārassa purimāpi koṭi na paññāyati, pacchimāpi koṭi na paññāyati;
analyzed: sa sārassa purimā api koṭi na paññāyati pacchimā api koṭi na paññāyati
translated: The beginning of the round of rebirths is not evident. The end is not evident.

original: majjheva saṁsāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā.
analyzed: majjhe iva sa sāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā
translated: Beings stand in the middle of the round of rebirths, are established, are attached, have come, have adhered, have become intent.

original: Kathaṁ saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati?
analyzed: katham sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: How is the beginning of the round of rebirths not evident?

original: Ettakā jātiyo vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakā jātiyaḥ vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “So many births have I passed through … ‘So many births have I passed through’—there is no such designation. Thus the beginning of this faring on is not discerned.

original: Ettakāni jātisatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni jātisahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni jātisatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni jāti satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni jāti sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni jāti sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “So many hundreds of births have I passed through … ‘So many hundreds of births have I passed through’—there is no such designation. Thus the beginning of this faring on is not discerned.🔽“So many thousands of births have I passed through … ‘So many thousands of births have I passed through’—there is no such designation. Thus the beginning of this faring on is not discerned.🔽“So many hundreds of thousands of births have I passed through … ‘So many hundreds of thousands of births have I passed through’—there is no such designation. Thus the beginning of this faring on is not discerned.

original: Ettakā jātikoṭiyo vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāḥ jāti koṭiyaḥ vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “So many koṭis of births have I passed through … ‘So many koṭis of births have I passed through’—there is no such designation. Thus the beginning of this faring on is not discerned.

original: Ettakāni jātikoṭisatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni jāti koṭi satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “So many hundred thousand koṭis of rebirths have gone by, and no more will come after that” — there is no such thing. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni jātikoṭisahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti, hevaṁ natthi.
analyzed: ettakāni jāti koṭi sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi
translated: “So many hundred thousand koṭis of rebirths have gone by, and no more will come after that” — there is no such thing.

original: Evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni jātikoṭisatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni vassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni jāti koṭi sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni vassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“So many hundred thousand koṭis of rebirths have gone by, and no more will come after that” — there is no such thing. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“So many years have gone by, and no more will come after that” — there is no such thing. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni vassasatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni vassa satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “So many hundred years have gone by, and no more will come after that” — there is no such thing. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni vassasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni vassasatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni vassa sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni vassa sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many thousands of years the round went on, but not beyond that”: there is no such case. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“For so many hundred thousand years the round went on, but not beyond that”: there is no such case. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakā vassakoṭiyo vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni vassakoṭisatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāḥ vassa koṭiyaḥ vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni vassa koṭi satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many millions of years the round went on, but not beyond that”: there is no such case. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“For so many hundred millions of years the round went on, but not beyond that”: there is no such case. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni vassakoṭisahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni vassa koṭi sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many billions of years the round went on, but not beyond that”: there is no such case. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni vassakoṭisatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni vassa koṭi sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many hundreds of thousands of millions of years the round has been revolving, but not beyond that” — there is no such determination. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni kappāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni kappasatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni kappasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni kappāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni kappa satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni kappa sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many eons the round has been revolving, but not beyond that” — there is no such determination. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“For so many hundreds of eons the round has been revolving, but not beyond that” — there is no such determination. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.🔽“For so many thousands of eons the round has been revolving, but not beyond that” — there is no such determination. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakāni kappasatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakāni kappa sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many hundreds of thousands of eons the round has been revolving, but not beyond that” — there is no such determination. So too, the beginning of the round is not evident.

original: Ettakā kappakoṭiyo vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni kappakoṭisatāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Ettakāni kappakoṭisahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakā kappa koṭiyaḥ vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni kappa koṭi satāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati  ettakāni kappa koṭi sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: “For so many koṭis of eons the round has been revolving, but beyond that it does not revolve” — there is no such case. Thus the beginning of the round is not discerned.🔽“For so many koṭis of eons times a hundred the round has been revolving, but beyond that it does not revolve” — there is no such case. Thus the beginning of the round is not discerned.🔽“For so many koṭis of eons times a thousand the round has been revolving, but beyond that it does not revolve” — there is no such case. Thus the beginning of the round is not discerned.

original: Ettakāni kappakoṭisatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ vatti, tato paraṁ na vattatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Vuttañhetaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“anamataggoyaṁ, bhikkhave, saṁsāro, pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṁ sattānaṁ taṇhāsaṁyojanānaṁ sandhāvataṁ saṁsarataṁ.
analyzed: ettakāni kappa koṭi sata sahassāni vaṭṭam vatti tato param na vattati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati 🔽vuttam ha etam bhagavatā 🔽bhikkhave sa sāro pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam taṇhā sayojanānam sandhāvatam
translated: “So many eons of world-dissolution,” “so many eons of world-evolution,” “so many eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many hundreds of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many thousands of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many hundreds of thousands of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many millions of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many hundreds of millions of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many billions of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution,” “so many hundreds of billions of eons of both world-dissolution and world-evolution”: there is no such definite reckoning.

original: Evaṁ dīgharattaṁ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhaṁ paccanubhūtaṁ tibbaṁ paccanubhūtaṁ byasanaṁ paccanubhūtaṁ, kaṭasī vaḍḍhitā.
analyzed: evam dīgharattam kho bhikkhave dukkham paccanubhūtam tibbam paccanubhūtam byasanam paccanubhūta kaṭasī vaḍḍhitā
translated: For a long time you have experienced suffering, experienced pain, experienced disaster, and have accumulated a great deal of suffering.

original: Yāvañcidaṁ, bhikkhave, alameva sabbasaṅkhāresu nibbindituṁ alaṁ virajjituṁ alaṁ vimuccitun”ti.
analyzed: yāvat cita bhikkhave alam eva sabba saṅkhāresu nibbinditum alam virajjitum alam vimuccitum ti
translated: That is enough, monks, to be repelled, enough to be detached, enough to be released.”

original: Evampi saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: evam pi sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: Thus the beginning of the round is not discerned.

original: Kathaṁ saṁsārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati?
analyzed: katham sa sārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: And how is the end of the round not discerned?

original: Ettakā jātiyo vaṭṭaṁ vattissati, tato paraṁ na vattissatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: ettakā jātiyaḥ vaṭṭam vattissati tato param na vattissati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: It is not the case that “after so many eons the round will have ended; after that there will be no further becoming.” Thus the end of the round is not discerned.🔽It is not the case that “after so many hundreds of eons…🔽after so many thousands of eons…

original: Ettakāni jātisatāni, ettakāni jātisahassāni, ettakāni jātisatasahassāni …pe…🔽ettakā jātikoṭiyo, ettakāni jātikoṭisatāni, ettakāni jātikoṭisahassāni, ettakāni
analyzed: ettakāni jāti satāni ettakāni jāti sahassāni ettakāni jāti sata sahassāni pe  ettakāḥ jāti koṭiyaḥ ettakāni jāti koṭi satāni ettakāni jāti koṭi sahassāni ettakāni
translated: after so many hundreds of thousands of eons…🔽after so many hundred-hundred thousands of eons…

original: jātikoṭisatasahassāni, ettakāni vassāni, ettakāni vassasatāni, ettakāni vassasahassāni,
analyzed: jāti koṭi sata sahassāni ettakāni vassāni ettakāni vassa satāni ettakāni vassa sahassāni
translated: after so many millions of eons…🔽after so many hundred millions of eons…

original: ettakāni vassasatasahassāni, ettakā vassakoṭiyo, ettakāni vassakoṭisatāni, ettakāni🔽vassakoṭisahassāni, ettakāni vassakoṭisatasahassāni, ettakāni kappāni, ettakāni kappasatāni,
analyzed: ettakāni vassa sata sahassāni ettakāḥ vassa koṭiyaḥ ettakāni vassa koṭi satāni ettakāni  vassa koṭi sahassāni ettakāni vassa koṭi sata sahassāni ettakāni kappāni ettakāni kappa satāni
translated: for so many hundreds of thousands of years, for so many millions of years, for so many hundreds of millions of years, for so many🔽billions of years, for so many hundreds of billions of years, for so many aeons, for so many hundreds of aeons, for so many

original: ettakāni kappasahassāni, ettakāni kappasatasahassāni, ettakā kappakoṭiyo, ettakāni
analyzed: ettakāni kappa sahassāni ettakāni kappa sata sahassāni ettakā kappa koṭiyaḥ ettakāni
translated: thousands of aeons, for so many hundreds of thousands of aeons, for so many millions of aeons, for so many hundreds of millions of

original: kappakoṭisatāni, ettakāni kappakoṭisahassāni, ettakāni kappakoṭisatasahassāni vaṭṭaṁ
analyzed: kappa koṭi satāni ettakāni kappa koṭi sahassāni ettakāni kappa koṭi sata sahassāni vaṭṭa
translated: aeons, for so many billions of aeons, for so many hundreds of billions of aeons the round will roll on, but not beyond that.’

original: vattissati, tato paraṁ na vattissatīti hevaṁ natthi, evampi saṁsārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: vattissati tato param na vattissati iti ha evam natthi evam pi sa sārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: But it is not like that. So too, the far end of the round is not discerned.

original: Evampi saṁsārassa purimāpi koṭi na paññāyati, pacchimāpi koṭi na paññāyati, majjheva saṁsāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttāti—
analyzed: evam pi sa sārassa purimā api koṭi na paññāyati pacchimā api koṭi na paññāyati majjhe iva sa sāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā ati
translated: So too, the near end of the round is not discerned, nor the far end of the round; beings stand right in the middle of the round, stuck in it, caught in it, entangled in it, and they have come under the sway of aging and death.

original: majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ.
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: They stand in the middle of the stream.

original: Iccāyasmā kappoti.🔽Iccāti padasandhi …pe….
analyzed: iccā ayasmai kappoti  i t ca ati pada sandhi pe
translated: So says the venerable Kappa.🔽‘So’: this is a particle …

original: Āyasmāti piyavacanaṁ …pe….
analyzed: āyasmā iti piya vacanam pe
translated: ‘Venerable’: this is a term of affection …

original: Kappoti tassa brāhmaṇassa nāmaṁ …pe… abhilāpoti—
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇassa nāmam pe
translated: The bird was named Kappo, the brahmin was named Abhilāṭa.

original: iccāyasmā kappo.
analyzed: i t ca ayasmā kappo
translated: Thus said the venerable Kappo.

original: Oghe jāte mahabbhayeti kāmoghe bhavoghe diṭṭhoghe avijjoghe jāte sañjāte nibbatte abhinibbatte pātubhūte.
analyzed: oghe jāte mahabbhaya iti kāma oghe bhava oghe diṭṭha oghe avijja oghe jāte sañjāte nibbatte abhinibbatte pātubhūte
translated: When born in the flood, in the great fear: when born, when generated, when created, when brought into being, when manifested in the flood of sense desire, in the flood of becoming, in the flood of views, in the flood of ignorance.

original: Mahabbhayeti jātibhaye jarābhaye byādhibhaye maraṇabhayeti—
analyzed: mahat bhayā iti jāti bhaye jarā bhaye byādhi bhaye maraṇa bhayā iti
translated: In the great fear: in the fear of birth, in the fear of old age, in the fear of sickness, in the fear of death.

original: oghe jāte mahabbhaye.🔽Jarāmaccuparetānanti jarāya phuṭṭhānaṁ paretānaṁ samohitānaṁ samannāgatānaṁ.
analyzed: oghe jāte mahat bhaye  jarā maccu paretānam ti jarāya samohitānam samannāgatānam
translated: When born in the flood, in the great fear.

original: Maccunā phuṭṭhānaṁ paretānaṁ samohitānaṁ samannāgatānaṁ, jātiyā anugatānaṁ jarāya🔽anusaṭānaṁ byādhinā abhibhūtānaṁ maraṇena abbhāhatānaṁ atāṇānaṁ aleṇānaṁ asaraṇānaṁ asaraṇībhūtānanti—
analyzed: maccunā phuṭṭhānam paretānam samohitānam samannāgatānam jātiyāḥ anugatānam jarāya  byādhinā abhibhūtānam maraṇena abbhāhatānam a tāṇānam a leṇānam a saraṇānam a saraṇībhūtānam
translated: When overcome by old age and death: when overcome by old age, when overcome by death, when overcome by old age and death, when overcome by birth, when overcome by old age,🔽when overcome by sickness, when overcome by death, when without protection, when without refuge, when without shelter, when having no shelter.

original: jarāmaccuparetānaṁ.
analyzed: jarā maccu paretāna
translated: When overcome by old age and death.

original: Dīpaṁ pabrūhi mārisāti dīpaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ gatiṁ parāyanaṁ brūhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi.
analyzed: dīpam pabrūhi mārisa ati dīpam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam gatim parāyanam brūhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi
translated: Tell us an island, O mariner: tell, teach, declare, reveal, make known, set forth, open up, analyse, explain, clarify an island, a protection, a refuge, a shelter, a support, a final relief.

original: Mārisāti piyavacanaṁ garuvacanaṁ sagāravasappatissādhivacanametaṁ mārisāti—
analyzed: mārisa ati piya vacanam garu vacanam mārisa ati
translated: ‘Dear Sir’ is a term of affection, a term of respect, a term of esteem, a term of courtesy. ‘Dear Sir’ is said.

original: dīpaṁ pabrūhi mārisa.
analyzed: dīpam pabrūhi mārisa
translated: Please show me the light, dear Sir.

original: Tvañca me dīpamakkhāhīti.
analyzed: tvam ca me dīpam akkhāhi iti
translated: You should show me the light.

original: Tvanti bhagavantaṁ bhaṇati.
analyzed: bhagavantam bhaṇati
translated: ‘You’ refers to the Fortunate One.

original: Dīpamakkhāhīti dīpaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ gatiṁ parāyanaṁ akkhāhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehīti—
analyzed: dīpam akkhāhi iti dīpam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam gatim parāyanam akkhāhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi iti
translated: ‘Show me the light’ means: please show (me) the light, the shelter, the protection, the refuge, the support, the final resort, please explain (it), please teach (it), please make it known, please make it clear, please make it plain, please make it evident.

original: tvañca me dīpamakkhāhi.🔽Yathāyidaṁ nāparaṁ siyāti yathayidaṁ dukkhaṁ idheva nirujjheyya vūpasameyya atthaṁ
analyzed: tvam ca me dīpam akkhāhi  yathāyidam na aparam siyāti yathayidam dukkham idha iva nirujjheyya vūpasameyya attha
translated: You should show me the light.

original: gaccheyya paṭippassambheyya punapaṭisandhikaṁ dukkhaṁ na nibbatteyya, kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: gaccheyya paṭippassambheyya punapaṭisandhikam dukkham na nibbatteyya kāmadhātuyā
translated: ‘So that this will not be again’ means: so that this suffering will cease right here, will be calmed, will be appeased, will be destroyed, will be abandoned, will not arise again, will not be produced again, will not be generated again, will not be manifested again, in the sense-world,🔽in the form-world, or in the formless-world, in the sense-desire-existence,

original: vā rūpadhātuyā vā arūpadhātuyā vā kāmabhave vā rūpabhave vā arūpabhave vā saññābhave
analyzed: vā rūpa dhātuyā vā arūpa dhātuyā vā kāma bhave vā rūpa bhave vā arūpa bhave vā saññā bhave
translated: in the form-existence, or in the formless-existence, in the perception-existence,

original: vā asaññābhave vā nevasaññānāsaññābhave vā ekavokārabhave vā catuvokārabhave vā pañcavokārabhave
analyzed: vā asaññā bhave vā nevasaññānāsaññā bhave vā ekavokāra bhave vā catuvokāra bhave vā pañcavokāra bhave
translated: in the non-perception-existence, or in the neither-perception-nor-non-perception-existence, in the one-constituent-existence, or in the four-constituent-existence, or in the five-constituent-existence,

original: vā punagatiyā vā upapattiyā vā paṭisandhiyā vā bhave vā saṁsāre vā vaṭṭe vā na janeyya
analyzed: vā punagatiyā vā upapattiyā vā paṭisandhiyā vā bhave vā sa sāre vā vaṭṭe vā na janeyya
translated: or to a destination, or to rebirth-linking, or to existence, or to the round, or to the system,

original: na sañjaneyya na nibbatteyya nābhinibbatteyya.
analyzed: na sañjaneyya na nibbatteyya na abhinibbatteyya
translated: he would not generate, would not bring about, would not make appear, would not cause to arise.

original: Idheva nirujjheyya vūpasameyya atthaṁ gaccheyya paṭippassambheyyāti—
analyzed: idha iva nirujjheyya vūpasameyya attham gaccheyya paṭippassambheyya ati
translated: Right here it would cease, subside, grow cold, and be stilled.

original: yathāyidaṁ nāparaṁ siyā.
analyzed: yathā ayi idam na aparam siyā
translated: So that it would not be again.

original: Tenāha so brāhmaṇo—
analyzed: tena āha saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: That is why that brahmin said:

original: “Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ,
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: “Standing in the middle of the flood,

original: (iccāyasmā kappo)🔽Oghe jāte mahabbhaye;🔽Jarāmaccuparetānaṁ,
analyzed: i t ca ayasmā kappo  oghe jāte mahat bhaye  jarā maccu paretāna
translated: (said the venerable Kappa)🔽In the great fear of the flood arisen,

original: Dīpaṁ pabrūhi mārisa;
analyzed: dīpam pabrūhi mārisa
translated: For those who are pursued by ageing and death,🔽Please tell me, dear Sir, the light

original: Tvañca me dīpamakkhāhi,
analyzed: tvam ca me dīpam akkhāhi
translated: And tell me the light

original: Yathāyidaṁ nāparaṁ siyā”ti.
analyzed: yathā yi idam na aparam siyāti
translated: So that it will not be again.”

original: Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ,
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: Standing in the middle of the flood,

original: (kappāti bhagavā)🔽Oghe jāte mahabbhaye;
analyzed: kappāti bhagavā  oghe jāte mahat bhaye
translated: (the Fortunate One said)

original: Jarāmaccuparetānaṁ,
analyzed: jarā maccu paretāna
translated: In the great fear of the flood arisen,🔽For those who are pursued by ageing and death,

original: Dīpaṁ pabrūmi kappa te.
analyzed: dīpam pabrūmi te
translated: I tell you the light, Kappa.

original: Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhatanti saro vuccati saṁsāro āgamanaṁ gamanaṁ gamanāgamanaṁ kālaṁ gati bhavābhavo, cuti ca upapatti ca nibbatti ca bhedo ca jāti ca jarā ca maraṇañca.
analyzed: majjhe sarasmim saraḥ vuccati sa sāraḥ āgamanam gamanam gamana āgamanam kālam gati bhava abhavaḥ cuti ca upapatti ca nibbatti ca bhedo ca jāti ca jarā ca maraṇañca
translated: Standing in the middle of the flood: the flood is said to be the round of rebirths, coming and going, coming and going, time, destiny, becoming and rebirth, decease and rebirth, birth and ageing and death.

original: Saṁsārassa purimāpi koṭi na paññāyati, pacchimāpi koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: sa sārassa purimā api koṭi na paññāyati pacchimā api koṭi na paññāyati
translated: No beginning is evident of beings’ roaming on, hindered by ignorance, tied to craving.

original: Majjheva saṁsāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā.
analyzed: majjhe iva sa sāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā
translated: Beings are caught up in the middle of the current, stuck in the middle, attached to the middle, and they don’t go beyond the middle.

original: Kathaṁ saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati …pe…
analyzed: katham sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati pe
translated: Why is no beginning evident of beings’ roaming on? …

original: evaṁ saṁsārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: evam sa sārassa purimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: That’s why no beginning is evident of beings’ roaming on.

original: Kathaṁ saṁsārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati …pe…
analyzed: katham sa sārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati pe
translated: Why is no end evident of beings’ roaming on? …

original: evaṁ saṁsārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati.
analyzed: evam sa sārassa pacchimā koṭi na paññāyati
translated: That’s why no end is evident of beings’ roaming on.

original: Evaṁ saṁsārassa purimāpi koṭi na paññāyati, pacchimāpi koṭi na paññāyati.🔽Majjheva saṁsāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttāti—
analyzed: evam sa sārassa purimā api koṭi na paññāyati pacchimā api koṭi na paññāyati  majjhe iva sa sāre sattā ṭhitā patiṭṭhitā allīnā upagatā ajjhositā adhimuttā ati
translated: So no beginning is evident of beings’ roaming on, nor any end.🔽Beings are caught up in the middle of the current, stuck in the middle, attached to the middle, and they don’t go beyond the middle.

original: majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ.
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: They stand in the middle of the current.

original: Kappāti bhagavāti.
analyzed: bhagavā ati
translated: Kappati bhagavāti.

original: Kappāti bhagavā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ nāmena ālapati.
analyzed: bhagavā tam brāhmaṇam nāmena ālapati
translated: Kappati bhagavā addresses the brahmin by name.

original: Bhagavāti gāravādhivacanametaṁ …pe… sacchikā paññatti, yadidaṁ bhagavāti—
analyzed: bhagavā ati gārava adhivacanam etam pe sacchikā paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati
translated: Bhagavā is a term of respect. … It’s a recognition of his realization. …

original: kappāti bhagavā.
analyzed: kappāti bhagavā
translated: Kappati bhagavā.

original: Oghe jāte mahabbhayeti kāmoghe bhavoghe diṭṭhoghe avijjoghe jāte sañjāte nibbatte abhinibbatte pātubhūte.
analyzed: oghe jāte mahabbhaya iti kāma oghe bhava oghe diṭṭha oghe avijja oghe jāte sañjāte nibbatte abhinibbatte pātubhūte
translated: “When the flood has arisen, the great terror”: when the flood of sensuality, the flood of becoming, the flood of views, the flood of ignorance has arisen, has been born, has come into existence, has come into being, has manifested,

original: Mahabbhayeti jātibhaye jarābhaye byādhibhaye maraṇabhayeti—
analyzed: mahat bhayā iti jāti bhaye jarā bhaye byādhi bhaye maraṇa bhayā iti
translated: “The great terror”: the terror of birth, the terror of old age, the terror of sickness, the terror of death,

original: oghe jāte mahabbhaye.🔽Jarāmaccuparetānanti jarāya phuṭṭhānaṁ paretānaṁ samohitānaṁ samannāgatānaṁ, maccunā
analyzed: oghe jāte mahat bhaye  jarā maccu paretānam ti jarāya samohitānam samannāgatānam maccunā
translated: “When the flood has arisen, the great terror.”

original: phuṭṭhānaṁ paretānaṁ samohitānaṁ samannāgatānaṁ jātiyā anugatānaṁ jarāya anusaṭānaṁ🔽byādhinā abhibhūtānaṁ maraṇena abbhāhatānaṁ atāṇānaṁ aleṇānaṁ asaraṇānaṁ asaraṇībhūtānanti—
analyzed: phuṭṭhānam paretānam samohitānam samannāgatānam jātiyā anugatānam jarāya  vyādhinā abhibhūtānam maraṇena abbhāhatānam a tāṇānam a leṇānam a saraṇānam a saraṇībhūtānam
translated: “Afflicted by aging and death”: those afflicted by aging, those who have been overcome by aging, those who are endowed with aging, those afflicted by death, those who have been overcome by death, those who are endowed with death, those who are followed by birth, those who are pursued by aging,🔽those who are overcome by sickness, those who are struck down by death, those who have no island, those who have no shelter, those who have no refuge, those who have no recourse,

original: jarāmaccuparetānaṁ.🔽Dīpaṁ pabrūmi kappa teti dīpaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ gatiṁ parāyanaṁ brūmi ācikkhāmi desemi paññapemi paṭṭhapemi vivarāmi vibhajāmi uttānīkaromi pakāsemīti—
analyzed: jarā maccu paretāna  dīpam pabrūmi kappa te iti dīpam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam gatim parāyanam brūmi ācikkhāmi desemi paññapemi paṭṭhapemi vivarāmi vibhajāmi uttānīkaromi pakāsemi iti
translated: “Afflicted by aging and death.”🔽“I proclaim the island, I proclaim the refuge”: I proclaim the island, the refuge, the shelter, the haven, the recourse, the ultimate security, I make it known, I make it clear, I reveal it, I set it forth, I disclose it, I analyse it, I expound it, I make it plain—

original: dīpaṁ pabrūmi kappa te.
analyzed: dīpam pabrūmi te
translated: “I proclaim the island, I proclaim the refuge.”

original: Tenāha bhagavā—
analyzed: tena āha bhagavān
translated: Therefore it was said:

original: “Majjhe sarasmiṁ tiṭṭhataṁ,
analyzed: majjhe sarasmin tiṭṭhata
translated: “Standing in the middle of the stream,

original: (kappāti bhagavā)🔽Oghe jāte mahabbhaye;
analyzed: kappāti bhagavā  oghe jāte mahat bhaye
translated: (The Blessed One is silent.)🔽When the flood has arisen, a great danger,

original: Jarāmaccuparetānaṁ,
analyzed: jarā maccu paretāna
translated: For those overcome by aging and death,

original: Dīpaṁ pabrūmi kappa te”ti.🔽Akiñcanaṁ anādānaṁ,
analyzed: dīpam pabrūmi kappa te iti  akiñcanam an ādāna
translated: I declare the light to you, O Kappa.”🔽“The unowned, the unaccepted,

original: etaṁ dīpaṁ anāparaṁ;
analyzed: etam dīpam anāpara
translated: This light, without a peer,

original: Nibbānaṁ iti naṁ brūmi,
analyzed: nibbānam iti nam brūmi
translated: I declare to be Nibbāna,

original: jarāmaccuparikkhayaṁ.
analyzed: jarā maccu parikkhaya
translated: The destruction of aging and death.

original: Akiñcanaṁ anādānanti.
analyzed: akiñcanam
translated: The unowned, the unaccepted:

original: Kiñcananti—
analyzed: kiñcananti
translated: The owned is this:

original: rāgakiñcanaṁ dosakiñcanaṁ mohakiñcanaṁ mānakiñcanaṁ diṭṭhikiñcanaṁ kilesakiñcanaṁ duccaritakiñcanaṁ;
analyzed: rāga kiñcanam dosa kiñcanam moha kiñcanam māna kiñcanam diṭṭhi kiñcanam kilesa kiñcanam duccarita kiñcana
translated: The owned by lust, the owned by hate, the owned by delusion, the owned by conceit, the owned by views, the owned by defilements, the owned by misconduct;

original: kiñcanappahānaṁ kiñcanavūpasamaṁ kiñcanapaṭinissaggaṁ kiñcanapaṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānanti—
analyzed: kiñcana ppahānam kiñcana vūpasamam kiñcana paṭinissaggam kiñcana paṭippassaddhim amatam nibbānanti
translated: The abandoning of the owned, the stilling of the owned, the relinquishing of the owned, the calming of the owned, the deathless, Nibbāna—

original: akiñcanaṁ.
analyzed: a kiñcana
translated: this is the unowned.

original: Anādānanti ādānaṁ vuccati taṇhā.
analyzed: anādānam ti ādānam vuccati taṇhā
translated: The unaccepted: craving is called the accepted.

original: Yo rāgo sārāgo …pe… abhijjhā lobho akusalamūlaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ rāgaḥ sa arāgaḥ pe abhijjhā lobho akusala mūla
translated: Lust, covetousness, hate, the unwholesome root of stinginess;

original: Ādānappahānaṁ ādānavūpasamaṁ ādānapaṭinissaggaṁ ādānapaṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānanti—
analyzed: ādāna ppahānam ādāna vūpasamam ādāna paṭinissaggam ādāna paṭippassaddhim amatam nibbānam ti
translated: The abandoning of the accepted, the stilling of the accepted, the relinquishing of the accepted, the calming of the accepted, the deathless, Nibbāna—

original: akiñcanaṁ anādānaṁ.
analyzed: akiñcanam an ādāna
translated: this is the unowned, the unaccepted.

original: Etaṁ dīpaṁ anāparanti etaṁ dīpaṁ tāṇaṁ leṇaṁ saraṇaṁ gati parāyanaṁ.
analyzed: etam dīpam etam dīpam tāṇam leṇam saraṇam gati
translated: This light, without a peer: this light, this refuge, this shelter, this resort, this recourse, this island, this haven, this to hold to, this going-forth, this brahmin, this contemplative.

original: Anāparanti tamhā paro añño dīpo natthi.
analyzed: anāparanti tamhā paraḥ aññaḥ dīpaḥ na atthi
translated: There is no other island beyond that.

original: Atha kho so evaṁ dīpo aggo ca seṭṭho ca viseṭṭho ca pāmokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cāti—
analyzed: atha kho saḥ evam dīpaḥ aggaḥ ca seṭṭhaḥ ca viseṭṭhaḥ ca pāmokkho ca uttamaḥ ca pavaraḥ ca ati
translated: That island is the foremost, the best, the pre-eminent, the highest, the most excellent.

original: etaṁ dīpaṁ anāparaṁ.
analyzed: etam dīpam anāpara
translated: That island beyond which there is nothing else.🔽I call that Nibbāna.

original: Nibbānaṁ iti naṁ brūmīti vānaṁ vuccati taṇhā.
analyzed: nibbānam iti nam brūmi iti vānam vuccati taṇhā
translated: Craving is called the forest.

original: Yo rāgo sārāgo …pe… abhijjhā lobho akusalamūlaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ rāgaḥ sa arāgaḥ pe abhijjhā lobho akusala mūla
translated: The greed, the delight, the craving, the greediness, the avarice, the avariciousness, the state of being avaricious, the state of being avaricious in the world—🔽the giving up, the abandoning, the forsaking, the letting go, the relinquishing, the releasing, the not clinging to, of that craving is Nibbāna.🔽I call that Nibbāna.🔽I call that Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.

original: Vānappahānaṁ vānavūpasamaṁ vānapaṭinissaggaṁ vānapaṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: vāna ppahānam vāna vūpasamam vāna paṭinissaggam vāna paṭippassaddhim amatam nibbāna
translated: The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.

original: Itīti padasandhi padasaṁsaggo padapāripūrī akkharasamavāyo byañjanasiliṭṭhatā padānupubbatāpetaṁ—
analyzed: iti iti pada sandhi pada sasaggaḥ pada pāripūrī akkhara samavāyaḥ byañjana siliṭṭha tā pada anupubba tā apeta
translated: The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.

original: itīti.
analyzed: iti iti
translated: The destruction of death is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.

original: Brūmīti brūmi ācikkhāmi desemi paññapemi paṭṭhapemi vivarāmi vibhajāmi uttānīkaromi pakāsemīti—
analyzed: brūmi iti brūmi ācikkhāmi desemi paññapemi paṭṭhapemi vivarāmi vibhajāmi uttānīkaromi pakāsemi iti
translated: The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.

original: nibbānaṁ iti naṁ brūmi.
analyzed: nibbānam iti nam brūmi
translated: The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of aging is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of death is Nibbāna.

original: Jarāmaccuparikkhayanti jarāmaraṇassa pahānaṁ vūpasamaṁ paṭinissaggaṁ paṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānanti—
analyzed: jarā maccu parikkhayanti jarā maraṇassa pahānam vūpasamam paṭinissaggam paṭippassaddhim amatam nibbānanti
translated: The destruction of sorrow and lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is Nibbāna.🔽The destruction of birth is Nibbāna.

original: jarāmaccuparikkhayaṁ.🔽Tenāha bhagavā—
analyzed: jarā maccu parikkhaya 🔽tena āha bhagavān
translated: The destruction of

original: “Akiñcanaṁ anādānaṁ,
analyzed: akiñcanam an ādāna
translated: “The unowned, the ungrasped,

original: etaṁ dīpaṁ anāparaṁ;
analyzed: etam dīpam anāpara
translated: This light, without a further side,

original: Nibbānaṁ iti naṁ brūmi,
analyzed: nibbānam iti nam brūmi
translated: I call it Nibbāna,

original: jarāmaccuparikkhayan”ti.
analyzed: jarā maccu parikkhayanti
translated: The ending of old age and death.”

original: Etadaññāya ye satā,
analyzed: etat aññāya ye satā
translated: Those who, knowing this, are mindful,

original: Diṭṭhadhammābhinibbutā;🔽Na te māravasānugā,
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma abhinibbutā  na te māravasā anugā
translated: In this very life are quenched;🔽They’re not under Māra’s control,

original: Na te mārassa paddhagū.
analyzed: na te mārassa paddhagū
translated: They’re not under the power of death.

original: Etadaññāya ye satāti.
analyzed: etat aññāya ye satā ati
translated: Those who, knowing this, are mindful.

original: Etanti amataṁ nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: etat ti amatam nibbāna
translated: This: the deathless, Nibbāna.

original: Yo so sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā khayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: It is the stilling of all fabrications, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.🔽Knowing: knowing, cognizing, discerning, fathoming, and realizing this with wisdom.

original: Aññāyāti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā, “sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti …pe…
analyzed: aññāya ati aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtam katvā sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā ati pe
translated: “All fabrications are impermanent” …

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ, sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhamma sabbam tam nirodha dhamman ti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtam katvā
translated: “Whatever has the nature of origination, all that has the nature of cessation.”

original: Yeti arahanto khīṇāsavā.
analyzed: yā iti arahantaḥ khīṇa āsavā
translated: Those: the arahants whose effluents are ended.

original: Satāti catūhi kāraṇehi satā—
analyzed: catūhi kāraṇehi satā
translated: Mindful: mindful in four ways.

original: kāye kāyānupassanāsatipaṭṭhānaṁ bhāventā satā …pe…🔽te vuccanti satāti—
analyzed: kāye kāya anupassanā sati paṭṭhānam bhāventā satā pe  te vuccanti satā iti
translated: They are mindful in developing the foundation of mindfulness that is contemplation of the body …🔽They are called mindful.

original: etadaññāya ye satā.
analyzed: etat aññāya ye satā
translated: Those who, knowing this, are mindful.

original: Diṭṭhadhammābhinibbutāti.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma abhinibbutā ti
translated: They are extinguished in this very life.

original: Diṭṭhadhammāti diṭṭhadhammā ñātadhammā tulitadhammā tīritadhammā vibhūtadhammā vibhāvitadhammā.🔽Abhinibbutāti rāgassa nibbāpitattā nibbutā, dosassa …pe…
analyzed: diṭṭha dhammā ati diṭṭha dhammā ñāta dhammā tulita dhammā tīrita dhammā vibhūta dhammā vibhāvita dhammā  abhinibbutā ati rāgassa nibbāpita ttā nibbutā dosassa pe
translated: ‘In this very life’: they know this very life, they see this very life, they realize this very life, they experience this very life, they penetrate this very life.🔽‘Extinguished’: they are extinguished through the extinguishing of sensual desire, they are extinguished through the extinguishing of hatred, they are extinguished through the extinguishing of delusion, they are extinguished through the extinguishing of all defilements, they are extinguished through the extinguishing of all unwholesome thoughts, they are extinguished through the extinguishing of all bad things.

original: sabbākusalābhisaṅkhārānaṁ santattā samitattā vūpasamitattā nijjhātattā nibbutattā paṭippassaddhattā santā upasantā vūpasantā nibbutā paṭippassaddhāti—
analyzed: sabba akusala abhisaṅkhārānam santa ttā samita ttā vūpasamita ttā nijjhāta ttā nibbuta ttā paṭippassaddha ttā santā upasantā vūpasantā nibbutā paṭippassaddhā ati
translated: They are extinguished, pacified, stilled, crossed over, and gone beyond.

original: diṭṭhadhammābhinibbutā.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma abhinibbutā
translated: They are extinguished in this very life.

original: Na te māravasānugāti.
analyzed: na te māravasā anugāti
translated: They are not in Mara’s grip.

original: Māroti yo so māro kaṇho adhipati antagū namuci pamattabandhu.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ māraḥ kaṇhaḥ adhipati antagū namuci pamatta bandhu
translated: ‘Mara’ is the black one, the lord, the end-maker, Namuci, the friend of the heedless.

original: Na te māravasānugāti na te mārassa vase vattanti, nāpi māro tesu vasaṁ vatteti.🔽Te mārañca mārapakkhañca mārapāsañca mārabaḷisañca mārāmisañca māravisayañca māranivāsañca
analyzed: na te māra vasa anugāḥ ati na te mārassa vase vattanti na api māraḥ tesu vasam vatteti  te mārañca māra pakkhañca māra pāsañca māra baḷisañca māra āmisañca māra visayañca māra nivāsañca
translated: They are not in Mara’s grip, they do not come under Mara’s power, nor can Mara do anything to them.🔽They have overcome Mara, Mara’s faction, Mara’s noose, Mara’s fetter, Mara’s bait, Mara’s domain, and Mara’s resort.

original: māragocarañca mārabandhanañca abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā
analyzed: māra gocaram ca māra bandhanam ca abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā
translated: They have overcome Mara’s domain and Mara’s resort, and they have gone beyond them.

original: madditvā caranti viharanti iriyanti vattenti pālenti yapenti yāpentīti—
analyzed: madditvā caranti viharanti iriyanti vattenti pālenti yapenti yāpenti iti
translated: they go, they live, they conduct themselves, they control themselves, they endeavour, they persist.

original: na te māravasānugā.🔽Na te mārassa paddhagūti na te mārassa paddhā paddhacarā paricārikā siyā;🔽buddhassa te bhagavato paddhā paddhacarā paricārikā siyāti—🔽na te mārassa paddhagū.🔽Tenāha bhagavā—
analyzed: na te māravasā anugā  na te mārassa na te mārassa paddhā paddhacarā paricārikā siyā  buddhassa te bhagavataḥ paddhā paddhacarā paricārikā siyāti  na te mārassa paddhagū  tena āha bhagavān
translated: They are not followers of Mara.

original: “Etadaññāya ye satā,🔽diṭṭhadhammābhinibbutā;🔽Na te māravasānugā,🔽na te mārassa paddhagū”ti.🔽Saha gāthāpariyosānā …pe…🔽satthā me bhante bhagavā, sāvakohamasmīti.🔽Kappamāṇavapucchāniddeso dasamo.
analyzed: etat aññāya ye satā 🔽diṭṭhadhamma abhinibbutā 🔽na te māravasā anugā 🔽na te mārassa paddhagūti 🔽saha gāthā pariyosānā pe 🔽satthā me bhante bhagavā sāvakaḥ ham asmi iti 🔽kappamāṇavapucchāniddesaḥ dasamaḥ
